definition: Borodin (name)/Alexander Borodin (1833-1887), Russian chemist and composer
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)

sentences.english: And a member of the Borodin belonged to one of the most talented composers.
sentences.chinese: 而成员之一的鲍罗丁属于最具天赋的一位作曲家。

definition: Modest Mussorgsky (1839-1881), Russian composer, composer of Pictures at an Exhibition
Piotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky (1840-1893), Russian composer, composer of 6 symphonies and the opera Eugene Onegin
Alexander Scriabin (1872-1915), Russian composer and pianist
Antonin Dvořák (1841-1904), Bohemian composer, author of nine symphonies including the New World symphony
Hector Berlioz (1803-1869), French romantic composer, author of Symphonie Fantastique
Rachmaninoff or Rachmaninov (name)/Sergei Rachmaninoff (1873-1943), Russian composer and pianist
pinyin: La1 he4 man4 ni2 nuo4 fu1

definition: Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
Niccolò Paganini (1782-1840), Italian violinist and composer
